title: CVE's found in prysm
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When are these Following CVE's gooing to be fixed in the following containers? CVE's found in prysm-validator and prysm-beacon-chain container. They look identical. 6 Critical CVE's! prysmaticlabs/prysm-validator (debian 9.13) =========================================== Total: 42 (UNKNOWN: 0, LOW: 2, MEDIUM: 19, HIGH: 15, CRITICAL: 6) prysmaticlabs/prysm-beacon-chain (debian 9.13) ============================================== Total: 42 (UNKNOWN: 0, LOW: 2, MEDIUM: 19, HIGH: 15, CRITICAL: 6) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I used Trivy to scan for CVE's ## üî• Error
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
ubuntu 20.04 server
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
prysmaticlabs/prysm-validator      HEAD-49dce5-debug   8e4c90c8712e   51 years ago   85.5MB
prysmaticlabs/prysm-beacon-chain   HEAD-49dce5-debug   404b04470217   51 years ago   110MB
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

Hey @texanraj , 

Thanks for the report, we are waiting on a resolution for this:
https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_docker/pull/1913#issuecomment-927019085

Hey @texanraj. Thanks for raising this issue. These CVEs are something we have been aware of for some time now. 
We've reviewed these CVE and none of them seem relevant to Prysm applications at this time.

With that said, we don't have an estimate on when you can expect that these CVE's are marked as resolved in Prysm docker images. @nisdas has asked for an update with the upstream default images. Although, that update will only reduce the number of CVEs to 35.

Another solution is to implement our own specific base image. 
We haven't prioritized this yet as we consider these CVEs to be a non-issue.

Current CVE list (reported from google cloud container registry):

| CVE Number | Severity | CVSS Score | Package |
|------------|----------|------------|---------|

| CVE-2018-6485 | High | 7.5 | glibc |

CVE-2019-1551 | Low | 5 | openssl |

We can update our base image in the following places where we have defined a base property

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/938a038c42a94e0e343fcbe85b95d7ee3dfcf195/tools/BUILD.bazel#L53-L61
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/938a038c42a94e0e343fcbe85b95d7ee3dfcf195/tools/BUILD.bazel#L63-L70

And then we have an alpine image we defined here:
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/18e1d433605724229076821f113ee04b0a9cd42b/WORKSPACE#L142-L147

Alpine has far fewer CVE, but it alpine is totally broken right now. One potential solution is to fix alpine images.
